description: Setting off from the Festival of Britain site we cover icons of the South Bank before heading into the back streets to see different types of social housing. We travel over to Bankside to see an overview of the historic and contemporary.

events.name: Beating the Bounds
events.notes: Takes place on Saturday 11th September only. Please email hello@paulmalone.co.uk to book. Deadline 1st September

factsheet.heading: About the Tour
paragraphs:
You tour is lead by Paul Malone who is an artist based at the APT studios in Deptford. For 40 years, Paul had a day job as a milkman for the area of the Tour and has seen first hand many changed here over the decades. He has worked recently as a tour guide for the Architecture Foundation.
Paul has a keen interest in all things urban and runs a website for street imagery - www.plasmazine.co.uk/streetsurfaces - This tour seeks to provide an overview of this part of London for those perhaps unfamiliar with the area, or those who only know it by its more popular aspects. The Tour will.be integrating the aesthetics of the street with historical documentation. Due to entry restrictions we will not be able to visit the interiors of the buildings.
Normally we finish at Borough High St.. 2 hours - 2 miles

location.address: By Information Boards, Just North (upstream) of the London Eye, Jubilee gardens, SE1 7PB
location.meeting_point: Look out for the SS (StreetSurfaces) board. If problem phone 07833504387.

name: Beating the Bounds 2022
